cab.content: Military Secret.1021From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of Stale for India,'2dt!i July 1919.[Repealed to Vladivostock.)(Received 30th.)10207. 29th July. Malleson wires 27th July, repeated Constantinople, Baku, Tiflis and Tehran. " Accord ing to reliable information, Askabad, there has been heavy fighting ' north of Tashkent,' presumably near Kazalinsk, within last few days. Bolsheviks are said to have lost seven guns and to have retired several stations in Tashkent direction. Presumably in consequence of above news, number of Bolshevik troops and eight guns left Askabad for the East on 20th June."
